item.description:
Hi all,
"Into Great Silence" is a meditative look at the daily routines of Carthusian monks set in a monastery in the French Alps."The rhythm of work, prayer and reflection,the attitude described as "joyful penitence" flows in a cycle that feels not so much ancient as timeless. The film's achievement is to capture, within a brief, elliptical span, this slow, delicate rhythm. " NY Times

Here is a full review:http://www.variety.co...

Until near the film's end, the human voice is heard only in chants and prayer.

Running time is 162 minutes.

Tom will be holding a meetup sign near the front row at the movie's end and then we will go to a local restaurant to discuss.
item.name: "Into Great Silence" at Kendall
